Hey guys my name is obviously Steven Jung. And I'm a 13 year old freshman 
in highschool. I was born in the church. But lately my faith has been 
faltering and I'm asking anybody here if is a normal phase. People at my 
church have been saying it is but it has been going on since the end of 6th 
grade. I go to revivals and retreats to restore my faith in the one and 
only God but I only feel it for as long as the retreat goes. So is it a 
normal thing? I really do hope it is because after this phase I will know 
that the one and only God loves me to no extent. Please reply!!! I am 
really worried﻿
top_comment.author: Steven Jung

comments.text:
It is normal don't worry. In some parts of our lives you may find it hard

comments.text:
i agrre with Calyn.  Every close relationship you have in your life 
required time.  You know your parents the way you do because you have spent 
so much time with them...same goes for your best friend.  It takes time. 
 But be diligent and read your bible and pray (you talking to God, and 
listening to allow Him to talk to you) everyday...the more time you devote 
to God, the more He will reveal Himself to you.  Speaking from experience. 
 Hope this helps :) I was in your shoes when i was around your age.  Start 
developing your relationship NOW while you're young...Jesus is coming back 
soon.  very very soon.
comments.author: rroyalty87

comments.text:
Hey Steven! Yes that is normal, but who wants to be normal right? :) My 
advice to you is to seek God daily. Do not wait for these retreats and 
revivals for a better understanding of Him. Yes they do help, but that is 
not the only option. Develop a personal relationship with Him. In any 
relationship you have with a person and you want to know him/her better, do 
you just speak to that person every couple months or so? I know I don't. I 
try to ask questions, and speak to them as often as I can. Your personal 
relationship with God will grow stronger and stronger if you talk to Him 
daily and spend time with Him daily by praying and reading His Word. Though 
He already knows all about you, don't you want to know more about who He 
is? I have been a Christian for the past five years and grew up in church 
also, but God still reveals more about Himself to I never knew before. Hope 
this helps! God Bless and I'll be praying for you! :)
comments.author: Calyn Navarro

top_comment.text:
I really like the whole 'young and free' theme, but I have some concerns 
like some people in the comments. Before any of you accuse me of being 
atheist or Buddhist and what not, I play guitar for my church so I do know 
a thing or two about worship music. I've been a Christian for all of my 
life as well. 

Anyways, some concerns that I have relate to the songs that hillsong y & f 
plays. From what I can gather, all of the songs in the album are 
fast-paced, exciting songs that really motivate me to worship God. While 
those songs may seem appealing to non-Christians, I don't think this theme 
will strengthen their relationship with God.Hillsong United and hillsong 
live plays the fast-tempo songs (ex: Go, Run, No reason to hide), but also 
the quiet, touching ones like forever reign and cornerstone. In my opinion, 
songs like the two mentioned above are what really makes me feel the holy 
spirit. Since the songs that this group plays are in an light atmosphere 
with the focus on praising God for fun, I dont see these songs touching 
hearts in the way that other hillsong divisions do.

This may be intended by Hillsong church, to bring people in through young 
and free and eventually lead them to the deep, spiritual Hillsong United 
and Live groups. Before all of you start hating on the people saying that y 
& f is bad, take a moment to realize that y & f are actually, in different 
categories than United and Live. Sure, they all praise God, but in 
different levels. Some people want more spiritual songs that United and 
Live give, and less of the songs influenced by the worldly values that y & 
f offer. 

I may be alone in thinking this. I hope not.﻿

Awesome! keep doing your thing Hillsong. Don't pay any mind to a single 
hate comment from people who don't even understand what worship is. Worship 
is NOT music. it is a lifestyle. Music is just one of the many means by 
which someone can worship. It can be a hymn, an upbeat techno song, taking 
out the trash, cutting the grass, working hard at your job... as long as 
you are glorifying God and showing Him reverence and adoration. That is 
worship. How dare anyone have the nerve to determine if a person's worship 
is genuine. That is God's job, He is the only One who can see the heart 
behind the worship. Please don't do God's job for Him, just worship Him 
however you want and let others worship Him how they want. He loves all of 
us the same regardless, lets just spread that around a little bit more than 
this ridiculous criticism.﻿

Pay close attention at how they are "worshiping".  I'm not saying the song 
doesn't have a good message and all but look at how they dance. This is not 
spiritual at all. They are not dancing because the holy spirit is in them 
but because they do it out of emotion. This type of worshiping is very 
close to the world's dancing. They might as well go to a party because 
that's exactly how people dance at parties. Romans 12:1 "And be not 
conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your 
mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and acceptable, and perfect, 
will of God. "    We are supposed to use Jesus as an example and I'm pretty 
sure you wouldn't find Jesus dancing like this. 1 Peter 2:21  "For to this 
you have been called, because Christ also suffered for you, leaving you an 
example, so that you might follow in his steps."   You can see people in 
this video taking their shirts off and making the rock sign with their 
hands.  It's hard to notice because the video goes by fast but if you pay 
close attention you'll see it. I'm not judging the song, but the dancing 
has to go. That's definitely not the Holy Spirit. My sister, who is't even 
a Christian, said "Umm you call that Christian?" Churches these days are 
being fooled into believing that this type of dancing is acceptable. The 
Holy spirit is what guides us and this is far from the Holy Spirit.
 God Bless you all. ﻿

comments.text:
Many are criticizing them for their form of dance... but how do you know 
that their prayer life isn't like it is shown in this video.  I've seen 
people dance w/o music, while praying, and nothing else... just very 
intense prayer!  Just because others worship in a different way than you 
and I doesn't mean that they aren't worshipping God.  I'm not the type of 
person that would label himself as charismatic, but I appreciate that God 
has formed us ALL in his likeness. The way we worship may be slightly 
different, but if our reason of being and living is to exalt the name of 
Jesus, then I'm sure God sees that and that isn't something that can be 
seen through this video as many of you suggest.

Additionally...
Isaiah 29:13-The Lord says: "These people come near to me with their mouth 
and honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me. Their 
worship of me is made up only of rules taught by men."  This seems to 
suggest that worship shouldn't be based on rules but instead on the 
boundless grace of God,  something that we see throughout David's worship.


Psalm 29
2 Ascribe to the LORD the glory due his name; worship the LORD in the 
splendor of his holiness. 3 The voice of the LORD is over the waters; the 
God of glory thunders, the LORD thunders over the mighty waters. 4 The 
voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is majestic. 5 The 
voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; the LORD breaks in pieces the cedars 
of Lebanon. 6 He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, Sirion like a young wild 
ox. 7 The voice of the LORD strikes with flashes of lightning. 8 The voice 
of the LORD shakes the desert; the LORD shakes the Desert of Kadesh. 9 The 
voice of the LORD twists the oaks and strips the forests bare. And in his 
temple all cry, "Glory!"

Now if the voice of the Lord does that... can you imagine what the Holy 
Spirit can do in us who have the Spirit of the Lord WITHIN US?!?!

top_comment.text:
@Tima Gearheart

Great analysis!!! This is exactly the kind of thing I am talking about.
Hillsong music is becoming less and less about the Gospel and Biblical 
accuracy while becoming more and more catered towards "mainstream."

Wake within Me, as Tima points out, is a great example of this (with the 
beats and all).
I'm not saying that this type of music is definitely wrong, but look at it 
this way...
A pastor is called to preach the Gospel. Many pastors today, however, try 
to preach topics. While topical preaching isn't necessarily bad, the focus 
should be expository. You ALWAYS want to root it back to the Cross. 
Whatever form worship/praise takes, you ALWAYS want to root it back to the 
Gospel.

This song, as Hillsong music has been of late, does not accomplish this. To 
some this may seem to be over critical... but we need to be (not over 
critical but very wary) or such changes. We often utilize "progression" in 
the wrong sense. Instead of building upon the traditions of Christianity, 
we completely knock down the foundations build throughout the years, 
construct our own, then call it "progress."﻿
top_comment.author: Timothy Oh

comments.text:
I agree, but there are a few things I would like to point out. Look at some 
of the earlier christian music, DC talk for example had this same type of 
goal. To utilize what was the popular type of music and apply faith 
centered messages to that genre. If every single christian song had the 
same format they would become dry and repetitive. Even older Hillsong music 
had this issue. On "United We Stand" a lot of the songs had the same chord 
progressions and basis. I feel refreshed whilst listening to this because I 
know there is a different audience that can be reached with this style. If 
you listen to the whole album, there are plenty of slower songs that still 
bring back memories of Aftermath and even Look to You. There has to be 
diversity or else you become stereotypical and that is exactly what drives 
people away. Ecclesiastes 3:1 says "for everything there is a season, and a 
time for every matter under Heaven" I feel as if this is a new season in 
worship, a time where the lost are found and new hearts are touched, not 
only in our nation, but at all corners of the Earth and this is a vessel we 
are using to reach those hearts. I am happy for what Hillsong Young & Free 
is doing with this new direction and I am excited to see how God moves 
through this team of individuals.

comments.text:
I am not trying to start an argument here but I think this comment and some 
replies has a few confusing points. As a young child, you like to jump 
around and have fun. The reason they made Hillsong Young and Free was so 
that they could create fun and energetic music without worrying about their 
Hillsong United band which is mostly for older people. When people dance to 
this song it's because they want to have fun and jump around. It's because 
they want to use their energy for God, and you don't don't get that kind of 
push to dance to slow songs. When you sing Come Though Fount (which is 
personally my favorite hymn) you don't want to jump around, you want to 
reach for Jesus and that's why when you sing hymns you lift your hands. If 
you feel the push to jump around during a hymn no one is going to stop you. 
It's kind of confusing but that's how Christianity is. But again not trying 
to start an argument.

comments.text:
+Timothy Brown We live in an ignorant society where most of the current 
generation is not interested in a message unless it looks cool while being 
delivered. I'm sure they've won many hearts over to Jesus because some of 
those kids initially were just attracted to the sound of the music, the way 
it looks, or the energy of the performance. Some of those kids wouldn't 
have gone to that summer camp if it didn't sound "cool", and I'm sure their 
friends were like "trust me, you're gonna love it!" and then the message 
started seeping into their head and they came face to face with the gospel 
and accepted Jesus into their hearts. Think of it this way: a wife drags 
her non-church-going husband to church on potluck Sunday, and the Lord 
starts working on his heart, and eventually he accepts Jesus as his lord 
and saviour. He didn't come there for the right reasons. He came there for 
the food, and for his wife. But God won him over through that. It doesn't 
matter if people listen to the message for the right reasons, so long as 
they hear the message. (Btw, true story- my dad.)

And there's a HUGE difference between looking like a model while retaining 
modesty and looking like a stripper. That's a different kind of attraction 
they are selling. This is not even comparable to Nicki Minaj, Beyonce, or 
Madonna. (That list goes on and on and on.) They picked this chick for her 
voice, she just happened to look amazing too. Ever heard of Mandisa? She 
doesn't look like a model, but she also sings about Jesus. And is 
successful!

Much love xX
